title: How to Create a Perfect Circle Without Tracing

steps.title: Find a drafting compass.
steps.content: Find a drafting compass. You can buy one at office supply or drafting supply stores.

steps.title: Put your pencil in the open leg of the compass.
steps.content: Put your pencil in the open leg of the compass.

steps.title: Adjust the compass for the radius of your circle.
steps.content: Adjust the compass for the radius of your circle. For a bigger circle, spread the compass wider.

steps.title: Set the stationary leg of the compass where you want the middle of the circle.
steps.content: Set the stationary leg of the compass where you want the middle of the circle.

steps.title: Keep the stationary leg stable as you move the pencil leg around in a circle.
steps.content: Keep the stationary leg stable as you move the pencil leg around in a circle.

steps.title: Choose a piece of paper.
steps.content: Choose a piece of paper. Place the paper on a flat, clean surface. The easier the surface is to move the paper on, the better, such as a well-polished table. Also, be sure to have plenty of space to be able to move the paper on the work surface.

steps.title: Place the pencil on the paper.
steps.content: Place the pencil on the paper. Press down on the point where the exposed wood on the pencil meets the painted part.

steps.title: Have the tip of the pencil touch the paper, so that the eraser end is sticking up.
steps.content: Have the tip of the pencil touch the paper, so that the eraser end is sticking up.

steps.title: Rotate the paper.
steps.content: Rotate the paper. While your index finger is holding the edge of the pencil described in Step 3, rotate the paper beneath the pencil with your free hand.

steps.title: Continue the rotation until a full circle is formed.
steps.content: Continue the rotation until a full circle is formed.

steps.title: Congratulations!
steps.content: Congratulations! You have now completed your circle.

steps.title: Divide the square equally into 4 smaller squares using a pencil and ruler.
steps.content: Divide the square equally into 4 smaller squares using a pencil and ruler.

steps.title: Draw round lines in one smaller square.
steps.content: Draw round lines in one smaller square. Start from one end of a bisecting line and take the half circle shape up to the next bisecting line, with the rounded edge sitting against the edge of the large outer square.

steps.title: Repeat for each small square until one large circle has been created inside the large square.
steps.content: Repeat for each small square until one large circle has been created inside the large square.

steps.title: Erase the square lines.
steps.content: Erase the square lines. Leave behind the circle.
